Title: FOR TWO YEARS FOR STEALING
text: Flinders-Prime Minister and Minister for External Affairs) [3.52] - I desire to inform the honourable member for Swan (Mr Gregory) that the report of the royal commission on Western Australian disabilities will be available in the very near future. I hope to be able to comply with MB request. I deeply regret that it will be impossible to accede to the request of the honourable member for Melbourne (Dr Maloney) that an opportunity be given for a vote to be taken [105] on the several motions on ' the notice paper in the names of private members. I remind him that once a dissolution has been announced, no business of any kind, other than the measures indicated in making the announcement, can be taken. I desire now to refer .lo the staten their ment by the Leader of the Opposition (Mr Charlton). In making my announcement to the House, I said nothing, beyond the actual facts, and did not attempt to make any reference of a political nature. I regret that in commenting on my statement, the Leader of the Opposition should have done so. I can only say that I am, indeed, glad, but very much surprised, that he welcomes an election with the enthusiasm which his remarks suggest. The next few weeks will prove whether he is really as enthusiastic as he appears to be today. I can assure the honourable gentleman that the course which I have taken has been definitely and clearly before me. It has not been dictated, as he suggested, by any desire to try to gain an advantage for the party which. I have the honour to lead in this House. I have taken it only because I have a very deep conviction that it is desirable at this time that the people of Australia shall express their opinion' whether the Commonwealth is to be governed by its duly elected Parliament or by outside extremists, and whether they wish to see law and order maintained in this Question resolved in the affirmative.
